title: Accidental landlords forced to sell up before April tax crunch
text:
The number of “accidental landlords” has plummeted in the last year as owners abandon the sector ahead of a new tax crackdown on rental properties in April.

These landlords are so called because they did not purchase a home with the intention of being a property investor.

Instead, they may have inherited a house or let out their existing property if they have moved elsewhere in the country for work.

However, these landlords have had to contend with an increasingly strict tax regime, which has reduced the amount owners can offset against their yearly tax bill.
